link_desc:
Template for SIAE digital radio based on custom shell script.

Behind the scene, the script uses SNMP

Features:

  • Modulation
  • Signal Level
  • Signal to Noise (SNR)
  • Temperature
  • Uptime
  • Trigger for SNR and uptime

Install instructions:

Step 1: install snmp-mibs-downloader package and execute download-mibs

Step 2: The package contains the template itself, the shell script and SIAE MIBS.

Extract the SIAE MIBS package in a directory of your choice, and configure snmp.conf file.

$ tar -zxvf Zabbix-SiaeScript-Template.tar.gz

$ cp -rf Zabbix-SiaeScript-Template/siae_mibs /opt

$ cat /etc/snmp/snmp.conf

mibdirs +/opt/siae_mibs

Step 3: $ cp siae.sh /usr/lib/zabbix/externalscripts/

After that, you should test it:

Step 4: ./siae.sh -m -A ip_radio

The result should be something like this:

2048QAM

Template tested on SIAE AGS20, if you tried in another SIAE model, let me know.

Obs: The template was created to monitor a 2+0 scenario, if you use 3+0 or 4+0 you need to create modulation, signal level, and SNR items.

Thanks.
author: Wesley Farias
